availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Martin (Greenup County, Kentucky, and Scioto County, Ohio, day laborer and farmer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, and Scioto County, Ohio, day laborer and farmer. Native of Germany. Married to Louisa Martin. Father of Elizabeth M. Martin, Emma Martin, George Martin, John Martin, Charles Martin, Hermina Martin, and Jerome Martin. Day laborer in Greenup County in 1860. Farmer in Scioto County in 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 110. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Green, p. 23. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Scioto County, Ohio, June 1863, p. 40, (Accessed via ancestry.com). KYR-0001-029-0583.
